name: N-methyl-2-[2-(2-methylphenyl)-2-oxoethyl]-N-phenylbenzamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2481
Reason: 1-ethylpiperazine-2,3-dione base melting point is around 106°C. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in dipole interactions and raise the melting point by approximately +5°C. The phenyl group, when connected to a piperazine ring, increases the melting point due to the additional pi-pi interactions and rigidity, estimated at around +20°C for each phenyl group. The methoxy group introduces additional rigidity, estimated at around +5°C. The ether linkage can also contribute to the melting point, albeit at a lower extent, estimated at around +2°C.
